info.name: Visual pathway, Meyer's loop
info.description: Meyer's loop is a portion of the geniculocalcarine tract or optic radiation that passes laterally beneath the lentiform nucleus and then loops through the temporal lobe before turning and traveling to the calcarine cortex.  The portion of the visual field that is represented in the fibers of Meyer's loop is the contralateral upper quadrant.  Temporal lobe lesions of Meyer's loop produce a contralateral upper quadrantanopia.
